canonical_explanation.text: 3D shapes (solids) have faces, edges, and vertices. Euler's formula relates these: F + V - E = 2 for any convex polyhedron. Nets are 2D patterns that fold into 3D shapes. We can draw 3D shapes on flat surfaces using oblique sketches or isometric sketches. Cross-sections of solids reveal 2D shapes when cut by a plane.
rules: A cube has 6 faces, 12 edges, 8 vertices
A cuboid has 6 faces, 12 edges, 8 vertices
A triangular prism has 5 faces, 9 edges, 6 vertices
A cylinder has 3 faces (2 flat, 1 curved), 2 edges, 0 vertices
A cone has 2 faces (1 flat, 1 curved), 1 edge, 1 vertex
A sphere has 1 face (curved), 0 edges, 0 vertices

questions.question_text: How many faces does a cube have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 6 square faces.

questions.question_text: How many edges does a cube have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 12 edges.

questions.question_text: How many vertices does a cube have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 8 vertices (corners).

questions.question_text: A triangular prism has ___ faces.
questions.explanation_correct: A triangular prism has 5 faces: 2 triangular and 3 rectangular.

questions.question_text: Verify Euler's formula for a cuboid: F + V - E = ?
A square pyramid has how many faces?
questions.explanation_correct: A square pyramid has 5 faces: 1 square base and 4 triangular faces.

questions.question_text: A square pyramid has how many vertices?
questions.explanation_correct: A square pyramid has 5 vertices: 4 at the base and 1 at the apex.

questions.question_text: A solid has 8 faces and 6 vertices. Using Euler's formula, how many edges does it have?
A solid has 5 faces and 8 edges. How many vertices does it have?
How many squares are needed to make a net of a cube?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 6 faces, so its net needs 6 squares.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has 6 faces = 6 squares in the net.

questions.question_text: There is only one possible net for a cube.
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 11 different nets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: There are 11 different nets that fold into a cube.

questions.question_text: The net of a cylinder consists of:
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder net has 2 circles (top and bottom) and 1 rectangle (curved surface unrolled).

questions.question_text: The net of a cone consists of:
questions.explanation_correct: A cone net has 1 circle (base) and 1 sector (curved surface unrolled).

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape does a net with 2 triangles and 3 rectangles form?
questions.explanation_correct: 2 triangles + 3 rectangles = triangular prism.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A triangular prism has 2 triangular and 3 rectangular faces.

questions.question_text: In an oblique sketch of a cube:

options.text: Front face is a square, depth edges are drawn at an angle

questions.explanation_correct: In an oblique sketch, the front face is drawn as a true square, and the depth is shown using lines drawn at an angle (usually 45 degrees) and shorter than actual length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Oblique sketch: front face is exact, depth is shown at an angle with reduced length.

questions.question_text: Isometric sketches use:

options.text: Dot paper with dots in square grid
Dot paper with dots in triangular pattern

questions.explanation_correct: Isometric sketches are drawn on isometric dot paper, which has dots arranged in a triangular pattern.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Isometric dot paper has dots in equilateral triangular arrangement.

questions.question_text: In an isometric sketch, edges along all three axes are:
questions.explanation_correct: In isometric sketches, all edges along the three axes are drawn to the same scale, preserving actual proportions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Isometric drawing preserves scale along all three axes.

questions.question_text: What is the cross-section when a cube is cut by a plane parallel to a face?
questions.explanation_correct: A plane parallel to a face of a cube creates a square cross-section.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cutting parallel to a face gives the same shape as the face: square.

questions.question_text: What is the cross-section of a cylinder cut by a plane perpendicular to its axis?
questions.explanation_correct: Cutting a cylinder perpendicular to its axis gives a circular cross-section.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perpendicular cut through a cylinder gives a circle.

questions.question_text: What is the cross-section of a cylinder cut by a plane parallel to its axis?
questions.explanation_correct: Cutting a cylinder parallel to its axis gives a rectangular cross-section.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A vertical cut through a cylinder gives a rectangle.

questions.question_text: A triangular pyramid (tetrahedron) has how many edges?
questions.explanation_correct: A tetrahedron has 4 vertices, 4 faces, and 6 edges. Check: 4 + 4 - 6 = 2.

questions.question_text: A pentagonal prism has ___ faces.
questions.explanation_correct: A pentagonal prism has 7 faces: 2 pentagons + 5 rectangles.

questions.question_text: A net made of 1 square and 4 identical triangles folds into a:
questions.explanation_correct: 1 square base + 4 triangular faces = square pyramid.

questions.question_text: How many faces of a cube are visible in an oblique sketch?
questions.explanation_correct: In an oblique or isometric sketch of a cube, 3 faces are visible (top, front, and one side).
questions.explanation_incorrect: 3 faces are visible: top, front, side.

questions.question_text: The shadow of a sphere is always:
questions.explanation_correct: The shadow (or any cross-section) of a sphere is always a circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere always casts a circular shadow.

questions.question_text: A hexagonal prism has how many vertices?
questions.explanation_correct: A hexagonal prism has 2 hexagons, each with 6 vertices = 12 vertices total.

questions.question_text: A hexagonal prism has how many edges?
questions.explanation_correct: Top 6 + bottom 6 + 6 vertical = 18 edges. Check: F+V-E = 8+12-18 = 2.

questions.question_text: A net of a tetrahedron consists of 4 equilateral triangles (for a regular tetrahedron).
questions.explanation_correct: A regular tetrahedron has 4 equilateral triangular faces, so its net has 4 equilateral triangles.

questions.question_text: What is the cross-section of a cone cut by a plane parallel to its base?
questions.explanation_correct: A plane parallel to the base of a cone creates a circular cross-section.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Parallel to the base gives a smaller circle.

questions.question_text: Which solid has the same number of faces and vertices?
questions.explanation_correct: Tetrahedron: F=4, V=4, E=6. Faces = Vertices.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has no vertex?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere has no vertices, no edges, and 1 curved face.

questions.question_text: A cone has how many edges?
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has 1 edge (the circular edge at the base).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone has 1 circular edge at the base.

questions.question_text: Which of the following CANNOT be a net of a cube?

options.text: Four squares in a row with one on top and one on bottom of the second square
Three squares in an L-shape with three more in another L
Six squares in a straight line
A cross shape made of six squares

questions.explanation_correct: Six squares in a straight line cannot fold into a cube because opposite faces would overlap.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A straight line of 6 squares won't fold into a cube â€” sides would overlap.

questions.question_text: The top view of a cone is:
questions.explanation_correct: Looking at a cone from the top, you see a circle (the base) with a point at the center (the apex).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Top view of a cone = circle with center point.

questions.question_text: The front view of a cylinder is:
questions.explanation_correct: The front view (side view) of a cylinder is a rectangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder from the front looks like a rectangle.

questions.question_text: What shape do you get when you cut a cuboid with a diagonal plane from one edge to the opposite?
questions.explanation_correct: A diagonal cut through a cuboid typically produces a rectangular cross-section.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A diagonal cut through a cuboid gives a rectangle.

questions.question_text: A pentagonal pyramid has ___ edges.
questions.explanation_correct: A pentagonal pyramid has 5 base edges + 5 lateral edges = 10 edges.

questions.question_text: A solid has 7 faces, 15 edges. How many vertices does it have?
The net of a triangular prism has:
questions.explanation_correct: A triangular prism has 2 triangular faces and 3 rectangular faces, so its net has 2 triangles and 3 rectangles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 2 triangular + 3 rectangular faces = net of triangular prism.

questions.question_text: The side view of a cube is:
questions.explanation_correct: Looking at a cube from the side, front, or top, you always see a square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube from any standard view looks like a square.

questions.question_text: Which solid has all faces as triangles?
questions.explanation_correct: A tetrahedron has 4 triangular faces. All faces are triangles.

questions.question_text: The cross-section of a sphere is always a circle.
questions.explanation_correct: Any plane cutting through a sphere creates a circular cross-section.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Every cross-section of a sphere is a circle.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has exactly 1 vertex?
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has exactly 1 vertex (the apex).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The apex of a cone is its only vertex.

questions.question_text: How many faces does a solid formed by folding a net of 4 equilateral triangles have?
questions.explanation_correct: 4 equilateral triangles fold into a tetrahedron, which has 4 faces.

questions.question_text: The front view of a sphere is:
questions.explanation_correct: From any view, a sphere looks like a circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere always appears as a circle from any direction.

questions.question_text: How many faces does a cylinder have (counting curved faces)?
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder has 3 faces: 2 flat circular faces and 1 curved surface.

questions.question_text: What shape is the cross-section of a cube cut diagonally through two opposite edges?
questions.explanation_correct: A diagonal cut through two opposite edges of a cube creates a rectangular cross-section.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This diagonal cut gives a rectangle.

questions.question_text: A prism with an octagonal base has how many faces?
questions.explanation_correct: Octagonal prism: 2 octagons + 8 rectangles = 10 faces.

questions.question_text: The number of rectangles in the net of a pentagonal prism is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A pentagonal prism has 5 rectangular lateral faces, so its net has 5 rectangles (plus 2 pentagons).

questions.question_text: The top view of a cuboid with dimensions 5 x 3 x 2 (length x width x height) is:
questions.explanation_correct: The top view shows the length and width: 5 x 3 rectangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Top view = length x width = 5 x 3.
